content: Having said that, and based on the stats that I just provided, weâre well positioned as it relates to our goal of around 6,000 patients â 6,000 Tyvaso patients by the end of the year, and weâre continuing to build really good momentum heading into next year. Your line is open. In terms of the DPI â in terms of the patients coming on, I will say that the DPI uptake, the uptakes have been faster on de novo than transitions, and I think thatâs just a function of as weâre out talking with physicians theyâre not proactively calling their existing Tyvaso patients and to transition them to DPI. Your line is open. One is, one, just I think the â just the United Therapeutics support services, the fact that weâve been in the market for 25 years, Physicians know us, they know that weâre committed to the patients. Your line is open. So itâs still really, I think, too early to tell whether thereâs a distinct difference between PAH patients and ILD patients, because I think, again, weâre still sort of I think, kind of ramping up these ILD treaters on whenâs the right time to put these patients on Tyvaso. Your line is open. But from the standpoint of United Therapeutics, itâs actually a lot better, because while there are, Iâve actually lost track of how many drugs are approved for PAH 12, as a reasonable guess, 14, almost none of them can be used in ILD because of the very real problem of V/Q mismatch, which I was talking with a physician the other day and they were telling me directly that one time for a patient who they were trying to transplant and gave them a little bit of  to try to help bring down their pressures before transplant saw horrible V/Q mismatch right away, when to inhaled prostacyclin and were able to successfully bridge the patient over to transplant. Your line is open. And youâve seen these posters, no doubt that ERS and other conferences that physicians have shown that if they aggressively dose Remodulin over a short period of time, bring pulmonary artery pressures down below 35 millimeters of mercury, and then fast switch their patients to a high dose of oral equivalent prostacyclin that they are reporting pretty much like Kaplan-Meier survival level close to a 100% at 10 years and even 15 years out. Your line is open.
